Name: Additional information collected and reported about foster care youth.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to additional information collected and reported about foster care youth

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council

Summary: This bill would amend the report on foster youth required by Local Law 145 of 2016 to require the data to be disaggregated by age. This bill would also require information to be collected on the council district of each supportive housing building to which foster youth are placed in.

Be it enacted by the Council as follows:\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj Section 1. Subdivision b and paragraph 3 of subdivision b of section 21-902.1 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as amended by local law number 145 for the year 2016, is amended to read as follows:\par
\cf1 b. Annual reports regarding youth and foster care. Beginning no later than February 28, 2015 for the calendar year 2014 and every year thereafter, ACS shall furnish to the speaker of the council, the public advocate, and post on ACS' website a report regarding youth in foster care. Such report shall include the following information disaggregated where available and indicated with an explanation where not available by \ul age,\ulnone  gender, race and ethnicity:\cf0\par
\cf1 3. Youth who left foster care who were discharged to APPLA. The following information regarding youth who aged out of foster care, shall be included in the annual report:\par
i. number and percentage of youth who were on trial discharge status;\par
ii. number and percentage of youth who received housing assistance, broken down by the type of assistance as follows:\par
(a) NYCHA public housing;\par
(b) section 8 voucher;\par
(c) supportive housing\ul , disaggregated by council district\ulnone ;\par
(d) adult residential care;\par
(e) ACS housing subsidy;\par
(f) any other type of housing assistance, whether private, federal, state or city-subsidized or operated, including information specifying the specific subsidies or resources utilized; provided, however, that the information required by this subparagraph shall be included in such report only upon required New York state approval of the necessary changes to the discharge checklist, beginning with the report for the second calendar year following such approval;\par
iii. number and percentage of young people who left foster care to alternative safe and stable housing, including but not limited to an apartment or other place of residence shared with friends or family members, or remained in the home of their foster families; provided, however, that this information shall be included in such report only upon required New York state approval of the necessary changes to the discharge checklist, beginning with the report for the second calendar year following such approval;\par
iv. number and percentage of youth who completed high school, disaggregated by the type of diploma or credential certification received;\par
v. number and percentage of youth who passed the TASC high school equivalency test;\par
vi. number and percentage of youth who obtained an education and training voucher;\par
vii. number and percentage of youth who are enrolled in college;\par
viii. number and percentage of youth who were enrolled in a vocational/trade program at the time of discharge;\par
ix. number and percentage of youth who obtained a college diploma, disaggregated by the type of diploma received; provided, however, that this information shall be included in such report only upon required New York state approval of the necessary changes to the discharge checklist, beginning with the report for the second calendar year following such approval;\par
x. number and percentage of youth who have a verifiable source of income;\par
xi. number and percentage of youth who obtained SIJS;\par
xii. number and percentage of youth who obtained lawful permanent resident status;\par
xiii. number and percentage of young people who were parents at the time of their discharge from foster care;\par
xiv. number and percentage of youth who had a permanent connection to a caring adult at the time of their discharge from foster care;\par
xv. number and percentage of youth who were discharged as absent without leave at the time of their discharge from foster care.\par
\pard\ltrpar\qj\cf0\'a7 2. This local law takes effect immediately.\ul  \ulnone\fs18\par
